item.title: 美联储降息希望渺茫，亚洲股市动荡不安：市场综述
item.description: 华尔街再次出现逢低买盘，推动部分股票反弹，扭转了因美联储重新调整押注而引发的大跌，亚洲股市看来将经历一段颠簸。【原文：Asian stocks look set for a bumpy ride after renewed dip buying on Wall Street fueled a rebound in some shares, reversing a selloff triggered by a recalibration of Federal Reserve wagers.】

item.title: 斯塔默希望在与伊拉克领导人的会谈中达成移民回返协议
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）希望在周二欢迎来自中东国家的伊拉克首相穆罕默德-希亚-苏达尼（Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani）来到唐宁街时，开始与伊拉克就移民回返协议进行谈判。【原文：UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer aims to start talks on a migrant returns agreement with Iraq when he welcomes his counterpart from the middle eastern nation, Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani, to Downing Street on Tuesday.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省警告征收石油关税，美加能源股走势分化
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省省长警告说，即将上任的特朗普政府很可能会对石油和天然气进口征收关税，在美国生产商反弹的情况下，加拿大石油和天然气股票仍创下了今年以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Canadian oil and gas stocks fell the most this year, even as US producers rallied, after Alberta’s premier warned that the incoming Trump administration is likely to put tariffs on oil and gas imports.】

item.title: 爱迪生公司称洛杉矶伊顿大火附近线路未发现问题
item.description: 爱迪生国际公司首席执行官佩德罗-皮萨罗（Pedro Pizarro）说，该公司没有在洛杉矶地区伊顿致命火灾起火点附近的输电线上检测到任何电力问题。【原文：Edison International Chief Executive Officer Pedro Pizarro said the utility did not detect any electrical issues on a transmission line near the start of the deadly Eaton fire in the Los Angeles area.】

item.title: 尽管存在经济衰退延长的风险，新西兰企业仍保持乐观态度
item.description: 新西兰经济研究所（New Zealand Institute of Economic Research）的数据显示，尽管2024年最后一个季度的利润放缓、贸易依然疲软，但新西兰企业对经济前景的乐观情绪仍在升温。【原文：New Zealand businesses are more upbeat about the economic outlook even as profits slowed and trading remained weak in the final quarter of 2024, according to the New Zealand Institute of Economic Research.】

item.title: 特朗普团队研究在紧急权力下逐步提高关税
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普即将上任的经济团队成员正在讨论逐月缓慢提高关税的问题，这种循序渐进的方式旨在增加谈判筹码，同时帮助避免通胀飙升。【原文：Members of President-elect Donald Trump’s incoming economic team are discussing slowly ramping up tariffs month by month, a gradual approach aimed at boosting negotiating leverage while helping avoid a spike in inflation, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Robinhood 将支付 4500 万美元和解美国证券交易委员会的索赔要求
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周一表示，Robinhood Securities LLC 和 Robinhood Financial LLC 同意支付 4500 万美元的民事罚款，以了结美国证券交易委员会的一系列指控。【原文：Robinhood Securities LLC and Robinhood Financial LLC agreed to pay $45 million in civil penalties to settle a range of US Securities and Exchange Commission allegations, the regulator said Monday.】

item.title: 监管机构探索收集交易前的小额债券价格
item.description: 市政债券市场的监管机构想知道是否应该开始收集某些州和地方政府证券的关键价格信息。【原文：The municipal bond market’s regulator wants to know whether it should start collecting key price information for certain state and local government securities.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火给保险业造成的损失可能高达 300 亿美元
item.description: 野火肆虐洛杉矶大片地区，在大火肆虐近一周后，保险业的损失可能高达 300 亿美元。【原文：Wildfires that have ravaged swaths of Los Angeles could result in losses of as much as $30 billion for the insurance industry as the blazes rage on almost a week after they ignited.】

item.title: 拜登的高级助手沙利文称，特朗普可能会维持新的人工智能芯片控制措施
item.description: 拜登政府的一位高级官员表示，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普很可能会维持美国对英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.）等公司在全球销售人工智能芯片的新限制，理由是两党对中国追求先进技术的国家安全关切。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump is likely to maintain new US limits on global sales of AI chips by Nvidia Corp. and others, a top Biden administration official said, citing bipartisan national security concerns surrounding China’s pursuit of advanced technology.】

item.title: 格陵兰首相表示愿意与特朗普合作
item.description: 格陵兰总理表示，他将寻求与美国建立更密切的关系，这凸显了这个北极岛屿在唐纳德-特朗普的再次关注下推动独立的决心。【原文：Greenland’s prime minister said he will seek a closer relationship with the US, highlighting the Arctic island’s push for independence amid renewed interest from Donald Trump.】

item.title: 迪拜将新建一所年薪 56,000 美元的私立学校，由 GEMS 创办
item.description: 世界上最大的私立学校运营商之一将在迪拜开设一所价值 1 亿美元的新校区，年学费可能高达 56,000 美元，因为该公司希望利用涌入海湾中心的超富裕家庭。【原文：One of the world’s largest operators of private schools is opening a new $100 million campus in Dubai where annual fees could reach as high as $56,000 as the company looks to capitalize on the influx of ultra-wealthy families that have made their way to the Gulf hub.】

item.title: 美联储资产负债表动态五年来依然沉重
item.description: 在美联储继续缩减资产负债表的同时，它仍然面临着五年多前同样的问题。【原文：As the Federal Reserve continues to unwind its balance sheet, it’s still dogged by the same issues that it faced more than five years ago.】

item.title: Databricks 从私人信贷和银行获得 50 亿美元融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，软件制造商 Databricks Inc. 已从包括 Blackstone Inc.【原文：Software maker Databricks Inc. has clinched more than $5 billion of financing from lenders including Blackstone Inc., Apollo Global Management Inc. and Blue Owl Capital Inc. in its largest debt raise to date, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Crypto.com 上的超级碗投注有望接受美国商品期货交易委员会的合法性审查
item.description: 联邦监管机构正在决定是否对 Crypto.com 期货合约交易的合法性进行调查，该合约允许投资者押注谁将赢得包括超级碗在内的大型足球比赛。【原文：Federal regulators are deciding whether to probe the legality of trading in Crypto.com futures contracts that let investors bet on who will win major football games including the Super Bowl.】

item.title: 财政部阿德耶莫前往哥伦比亚，关注能源制裁问题
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，财政部二号官员沃利-阿德耶莫（Wally Adeyemo）将离开拜登政府，前往哥伦比亚大学任职，主要负责经济外交和能源政策。【原文：Wally Adeyemo, the number-two official at the Treasury Department, will leave the Biden administration for a role at Columbia University focusing on economic statecraft and energy policy, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储暂停货币政策的预期威胁了 1 月份的收益率
item.description: 人们对美联储将暂缓进一步降息的预期不断增强，这使得本应在本月取得强劲回报的市政债券受挫。【原文：Growing expectations that the Federal Reserve will hold off on further interest-rate cuts are foiling what should have been a strong month of municipal bond returns.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火肆虐，爱迪生国际公司债券跌幅扩大
item.description: 爱迪生国际公司（Edison International）的电力公司所在地南加州野火肆虐，该公司债券周一相对于国债走软，延续了一周来的跌势。【原文：Edison International’s bonds weakened on Monday relative to Treasuries, extending a week of losses, after wildfires raged in Southern California where the company’s electric utility is based.】

item.title: 迫于埃利奥特压力，霍尼韦尔计划解体

item.title: 微策略公司的赛勒在推销比特币时称债券为 "有毒 "债券
item.description: MicroStrategy 公司联合创始人兼董事长迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）认为，公司应该购买比特币，因为债券是 "有毒的"。【原文：Companies should buy Bitcoin because bonds are “toxic,” according to MicroStrategy Inc. co-founder and Chairman Michael Saylor.】

item.title: 关税抑制前景，加拿大债券收益率逆全球趋势而动
item.description: 全球各地的政府债券收益率都在飙升。加拿大是一个明显的例外。【原文：Government bond yields are surging across the globe. One notable exception is Canada.】

item.title: 监督机构称芝加哥学校董事会必须尽快采取行动结束危机
item.description: 公民联合会（Civic Federation）表示，芝加哥公立学校新一届董事会的 21 名成员周三上任后，将面临劳动力成本上升、赤字增加、养老金资金不足以及信用评级 "脆弱 "等问题。【原文：The Chicago Public Schools’ new board faces rising labor costs, growing deficits, underfunded pensions and “fragile” credit ratings when its 21 members take office Wednesday, said the Civic Federation.】

item.title: 墨西哥计划近岸外包激励措施以遏制中国进口
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）宣布了一项减少从中国进口的计划，以支持当地工业，并与作为贸易伙伴的美国保持一致。【原文：Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum announced a plan to reduce the country’s imports from China in a bid to support local industry and align herself with the US as a trade partner.】

item.title: 关税在即，安大略省就矿业交易向特朗普抛出橄榄枝
item.description: 在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要对加拿大北部国家征收瘫痪性关税之际，加拿大人口最多省份的领导人提出要在关键矿产方面与美国结成 "新的战略联盟"。【原文：The leader of Canada’s most populous province is pitching a “renewed strategic alliance” with the US on critical minerals, as President-elect Donald Trump threatens crippling tariffs on the northern nation.】

item.title: 克利夫兰-克里夫斯和纽柯考虑联合竞购美国钢铁公司

item.title: 美国银行认为期限风险抑制了对公司债券的需求
item.description: 美国银行的策略师预计，今年降息次数减少的前景将削弱对期限较长的投资级债券的需求。【原文：Bank of America strategists expect the prospect of fewer interest-rate cuts this year to weaken the demand for longer-duration, investment-grade bonds.】

item.title: 特朗普上台，华尔街认为美元将进一步反弹
item.description: 华尔街预测美元将进一步走高，因为美国经济复苏，降息预期减弱，而美国新任总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发誓要征收严厉的关税。【原文：Wall Street is forecasting even more gains in the dollar as a resilient US economy and dwindling expectations for interest-rate cuts coincide with incoming President Donald Trump’s vows for harsh tariffs.】

item.title: 洛杉矶公用事业公司债券销售在火灾中陷入困境
item.description: 在南加州野火肆虐的情况下，洛杉矶水电局原本预计本周发行的债券在周一转入 "日常状态"。【原文：A bond offering by the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power that was expected to price this week moved to “day to day status” on Monday amid the wildfires in Southern California, according to people familiar with the matter, who asked not to be identified discussing the deal.】

item.title: 预算僵局令法国企业陷入不确定迷雾
item.description: 法国银行表示，法国企业继续面临该国长期预算危机带来的更大不确定性，导致经济前景低迷。【原文：French businesses continue to face heightened uncertainty from the country’s prolonged budget crisis, contributing to a sluggish economic outlook, the Bank of France said.】
